q: When it comes to mastering a skill, time is the magic ingredient.
h:
“When it comes to mastering a skill, time is the magic ingredient.” —
Robert Greene

q: Be gentle with yourself. Think less and feel more. Be as happy as you can. You only have this moment.
h:
“Be gentle with yourself. Think less and feel more. Be as happy as you can. You only have this moment.” —
Dan Millman

q: The quality of your life is the quality of your relationships.
h:
“The quality of your life is the quality of your relationships.” —
Tony Robbins

q: What would life be if we had no courage to attempt anything?
h:
“What would life be if we had no courage to attempt anything? ” —
Vincent van Gogh

q: We need never be ashamed of our tears.
h:
“We need never be ashamed of our tears.” —
Charles Dickens

q: There are two primary choices in life: to accept conditions as they exist, or accept the responsibility for changing them.
h:
“There are two primary choices in life: to accept conditions as they exist, or accept the responsibility for changing them.” —
Denis Waitley

q: To understand the heart and mind of a person, look not at what he has already achieved, but at what he aspires to.
h:
“To understand the heart and mind of a person, look not at what he has already achieved, but at what he aspires to.” —
Kahlil Gibran

q: A minute's success pays the failure of years.
h:
“A minute's success pays the failure of years.” —
Robert Browning

q: Every limit is a beginning as well as an ending.
h:
“Every limit is a beginning as well as an ending.” —
George Eliot

q: Once you choose hope, anything's possible.
h:
“Once you choose hope, anything's possible.” —
Christopher Reeve

q: There is no sadder sight than a young pessimist.
h:
“There is no sadder sight than a young pessimist.” —
Mark Twain

q: Your imagination is your preview of life's coming attractions.
h:
“Your imagination is your preview of life's coming attractions.” —
Albert Einstein

q: The more you are focused on time - past and future - the more you miss the Now, the most precious thing there is.
h:
“The more you are focused on time - past and future - the more you miss the Now, the most precious thing there is.” —
Eckhart Tolle

q: Never buy a thing you do not want, because it is cheap, it will be dear to you.
h:
“Never buy a thing you do not want, because it is cheap, it will be dear to you.” —
Thomas Jefferson

q: If you're afraid - don't do it, - if you're doing it - don't be afraid!
h:
“If you're afraid - don't do it, - if you're doing it - don't be afraid! ” —
Genghis Khan

q: Most of us will do anything to avoid facing ourselves.
h:
“Most of us will do anything to avoid facing ourselves.” —
Lolly Daskal

q: Setting goals is the first step in turning the invisible into the visible.
h:
“Setting goals is the first step in turning the invisible into the visible.” —
Tony Robbins

q: We learn by pushing ourselves and finding what really lies at the outer reaches of our abilities.
h:
“We learn by pushing ourselves and finding what really lies at the outer reaches of our abilities.” —
Josh Waitzkin

q: There is little success where there is little laughter.
h:
“There is little success where there is little laughter.” —
Andrew Carnegie

q: You don't need a weatherman to know which way the wind blows.
h:
“You don't need a weatherman to know which way the wind blows.” —
Bob Dylan

q: The one who praises you is a thief. The one who criticizes you is your true friend.
h:
“The one who praises you is a thief. The one who criticizes you is your true friend.” —
Seungsahn

q: Take care of your body. It's the only place you have to live.
h:
“Take care of your body. It's the only place you have to live.” —
Jim Rohn

q: Good judgment comes from experience, and experience comes from bad judgment.
h:
“Good judgment comes from experience, and experience comes from bad judgment.” —
Rita Mae Brown

q: Lying can never save us from another lie.
h:
“Lying can never save us from another lie.” —
Vaclav Havel

q: Not all those who wander are lost.
h:
“Not all those who wander are lost.” —
J.R.R. Tolkien

q: As long as a human being worries about when he will die, and what he has that is his, all of his works are zero.
h:
“As long as a human being worries about when he will die, and what he has that is his, all of his works are zero.” —
Kabir

q: If you hang out with chickens, you're going to cluck and if you hang out with eagles, you're going to fly.
h:
“If you hang out with chickens, you're going to cluck and if you hang out with eagles, you're going to fly.” —
Steve Maraboli

q: What you are afraid of is never as bad as what you imagine. The fear you let build up in your mind is worse than the situation that actually exists.
h:
“What you are afraid of is never as bad as what you imagine. The fear you let build up in your mind is worse than the situation that actually exists.” —
Spencer Johnson

q: Nature is pleased with simplicity. And nature is no dummy.
h:
“Nature is pleased with simplicity. And nature is no dummy.” —
Isaac Newton

q: The divine is not something high above us. It is in heaven, it is in earth, it is inside us.
h:
“The divine is not something high above us. It is in heaven, it is in earth, it is inside us.” —
Morihei Ueshiba

q: Only by acceptance of the past, can you alter it.
h:
“Only by acceptance of the past, can you alter it.” —
T.S. Eliot

q: Unless you change how you are, you will always have what you got.
h:
“Unless you change how you are, you will always have what you got.” —
Jim Rohn

q: No matter who you are, we're creatures of habit. The better your habits are, the better they will be in pressure situations.
h:
“No matter who you are, we're creatures of habit. The better your habits are, the better they will be in pressure situations.” —
Wayne Gretzky

q: Trust in dreams, for in them is the hidden gate to eternity.
h:
“Trust in dreams, for in them is the hidden gate to eternity. ” —
Kahlil Gibran

q: If you want peace, accept. If you want suffering, expect.
h:
“If you want peace, accept. If you want suffering, expect.” —
Maxime Lagace

q: The most important battle is one to conquer yourself.
h:
“The most important battle is one to conquer yourself.” —
Yanni

q: When you know what you want, and want it bad enough, you will find a way to get it.
h:
“When you know what you want, and want it bad enough, you will find a way to get it.” —
Jim Rohn

q: Every time we liberate a woman, we liberate a man.
h:
“Every time we liberate a woman, we liberate a man. ” —
Margaret Mead

q: Make each day a new horizon.
h:
“Make each day a new horizon.” —
Christopher McCandless

q: If you think you can do a thing or think you can't do a thing, you're right.
h:
“If you think you can do a thing or think you can't do a thing, you're right.” —
Henry Ford

q: What you get by achieving your goals is not as important as what you become by achieving your goals.
h:
“What you get by achieving your goals is not as important as what you become by achieving your goals.” —
Henry David Thoreau

q: Live calmly. The time will come when the flowers bloom by themselves.
h:
“Live calmly. The time will come when the flowers bloom by themselves.” —
Zen Proverb

q: Well done is better than well said.
h:
“Well done is better than well said.” —
Benjamin Franklin

q: There are two ways of seeing: with the body and with the soul. The body's sight can sometimes forget, but the soul remembers forever.
h:
“There are two ways of seeing: with the body and with the soul. The body's sight can sometimes forget, but the soul remembers forever.” —
Alexandre Dumas

q: Every moment you get is a gift. Spend it on things that matter. Don't spend it by dwelling on unhappy things.
h:
“Every moment you get is a gift. Spend it on things that matter. Don't spend it by dwelling on unhappy things.” —
Celestine Chua

q: Go for it now. The future is promised to no one.
h:
“Go for it now. The future is promised to no one. ” —
Wayne Dyer

q: Take care of your cents: dollars will take care of themselves.
h:
“Take care of your cents: dollars will take care of themselves.” —
Thomas Jefferson

q: Conscience is a dog that does not stop us from passing but that we cannot prevent from barking.
h:
“Conscience is a dog that does not stop us from passing but that we cannot prevent from barking.” —
Nicolas Chamfort

q: Nothing has any power over me other than that which I give it through my conscious thoughts.
h:
“Nothing has any power over me other than that which I give it through my conscious thoughts.” —
Tony Robbins

q: To be fully alive is to feel that everything is possible.
h:
“To be fully alive is to feel that everything is possible.” —
Eric Hoffer

q: Most people fail in life because they major in minor things.
h:
“Most people fail in life because they major in minor things.” —
Tony Robbins

q: Be willing to be a beginner every single morning.
h:
“Be willing to be a beginner every single morning.” —
Meister Eckhart
